name: Roasted Butternut Squash and Corn Salad with Cranberries and Cilantro

image.caption: Roasted Butternut Squash and Corn Salad with Cranberries and Cilantro

description: Perfect side dish for fall, may be served warm or cold. Also note that it is gluten-free!
recipeIngredient: 1 pound butternut squash, peeled and diced, or more to taste
4 ears corn on the cob, husks and silk removed
1 tablespoon olive oil, or as needed

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Arrange butternut squash into a single layer onto a baking pan. Drizzle 1 tablespoon olive oil on top. Wrap each ear of corn in aluminum foil.
Bake in the preheated oven until squash is tender, about 15 minutes. Continue cooking corn until charred, about 15 minutes more.
Cut corn kernels off cob; place in a container with the butternut squash.

Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add red onion; cook and stir until softened and translucent, about 5 minutes. Add cranberries; cook and stir until soft and slightly plump, 5 to 7 minutes. Transfer onion and cranberries to the squash mixture.
Combine the remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil, lemon juice, chile paste, garlic powder, vinegar, and paprika in a bowl. Toss with the cranberry-squash mixture. Mix cilantro into the salad.

aggregateRating.itemReviewed: Roasted Butternut Squash and Corn Salad with Cranberries and Cilantro

review.reviewBody: First, THANK YOU for this recipe! It was exactly what we were looking for after enjoying a similar side dish at Nando’s Peri Peri Chicken last December. I can’t speak to how exactly it matches the restaurant dish since so many months have passed, but this is an absolute hit for our fall meals. I’ve made it 3 times in 3 weeks already, nearly exactly as written, and we love it. Confession – we haven’t had the chile paste, which is probably a major flavor element, so I can’t be sure if our substitute of cayenne pepper is the same. Our result has a spicy sweet heat, and it’s a great side to anything, with leftovers a favorite for our lunches. I’m sorry I didn’t take a photo (maybe next time) – I already bought another squash!
